    Gene names in different databases
  • Changelog

    Gene names in different databases

    2023-09-25

    GeneIDs.Rmd

    Motivation

    The GeneID labels differ across databases. This is a potential problem when gene age inference has been performed from protein sequences obtained from one database (e.g. UniProtKB) and the RNA-seq quantification has been performed on genes from another database (e.g. ENSEMBL).

    Solution

    In phylomapr, we try to mitigate this issue using the helper function convertID(), which essentially wraps around the function biomart() in the biomartr package. In this article, we give an example of how C. elegans phylomaps can be converted.

    First, the following two function in biomartr can be used to obtain the phylomaps.

    c_elegans_BM.filt <- organismFilters(organism = "Caenorhabditis elegans", topic = "id")
    c_elegans_BM.filt
    #> # A tibble: 108 × 4
#>    name                  description                                           dataset               mart                
#>    <chr>                 <chr>                                                 <chr>                 <chr>               
#>  1 with_protein_id       With INSDC protein ID ID(s)                           celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#>  2 with_refseq_peptide   With RefSeq peptide ID(s)                             celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#>  3 with_wormpep_id       With Wormpep ID ID(s)                                 celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#>  4 ensembl_gene_id       Gene stable ID(s) [e.g. WBGene00000001]               celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#>  5 ensembl_transcript_id Transcript stable ID(s) [e.g. 2L52.1a.1]              celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#>  6 ensembl_peptide_id    Protein stable ID(s) [e.g. 2L52.1a.1]                 celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#>  7 ensembl_exon_id       Exon ID(s) [e.g. 2L52.1a.1.e1]                        celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#>  8 protein_id            INSDC protein ID(s) [e.g. AAA03517]                   celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#>  9 entrezgene_id         NCBI gene (formerly Entrezgene) ID(s) [e.g. 13179109] celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#> 10 refseq_peptide        RefSeq peptide ID(s) [e.g. NP_001020957]              celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL
#> # ℹ 98 more rows

    Here, we can see that the uniprot_gn_id filter is available and can be employed with the dataset celegans_gene_ensembl from mart ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL.

    Next, we convert the GeneID labels from uniprot to ensembl.

    # here we use the dataset phylomapr::Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap
Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap.ENSEMBL <- 
  phylomapr::convertID(
    phylomap = phylomapr::Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap,
    mart = "ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL",
    dataset = "celegans_gene_ensembl",
    filters = "uniprot_gn_id"
    )
    #> Starting Gene ID conversion...
    #> Starting BioMart query ...
    #> Warning: Ensembl will soon enforce the use of https.
#> Ensure the 'host' argument includes "https://"
    > phylomapr::Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap
# A tibble: 19,818 × 2
   Phylostratum GeneID                   
          <dbl> <chr>                    
 1            2 sp|A0A061ACU2|PIEZ1_CAEEL
 2            3 sp|A0A078BQN7|FKH3_CAEEL 
 3            1 sp|A0A078BQP2|GCY25_CAEEL
 4           10 sp|A0A0K3AUE4|SEA2_CAEEL 
 5            1 sp|A0A0K3AUJ9|PRDX_CAEEL 
 6            1 sp|A0A0K3AV08|MLK1_CAEEL 
 7            1 sp|A0A0K3AWM6|MOM5_CAEEL 
 8            3 sp|A0A0K3AXH1|ARID1_CAEEL
 9            1 sp|A0A131MBU3|IRG7_CAEEL 
10            1 sp|A0A131MCZ8|CNNM3_CAEEL
# ℹ 19,808 more rows
# ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows
    > Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap.ENSEMBL
# A tibble: 10,510 × 2
   Phylostratum GeneID        
          <dbl> <chr>         
 1            3 WBGene00000001
 2            1 WBGene00000002

 4            1 WBGene00000004

# ℹ 10,500 more rows
# ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

    Discussion

    While the conversion issue between databases are mitigated, there are still some aspects to be improved. For example, we can see a drop in the number of genes now in the phylomap. Despite this, until a phylomap is created for the ENSEMBL genes, this function provides a stop-gap measure.
